noun.description: Any of the five digits at the end of the human foot.
examples: he cut his big toe on a sharp stone

noun.description: The lower end, tip, or point of something.

verb.description: Push, touch, or kick (something) with one's toe.
examples: he toed off his shoes and flexed his feet

verb.description: Walk with the toes pointed in (or out)
examples: he toes out when he walks

phrases: I try to avoid looking at the artwork because it makes my toes curl.
I must say, it made my toes curl, just reading it.
This cuts out the opportunity for a serendipitous find - someone who doesn't match your check list, but still makes your toes curl.
It's enough to make your toes curl - mine anyway.
You love to be catered to, that's what really makes your toes curl.
origin: Old English tā, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch tee and German Zeh, Zehe. Current senses of the verb date from the mid 19th century.
